[24-Oct-21 02:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CptWaffles**:	If im consuming 0.4 units per day. Does that mean behind the scenes there are fractions going on, or is it rounded ?


[24-Oct-21 02:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TwilightSentinel**:	You always consume a whole number, but it won't consume the next one until after you get through the fraction.


[24-Oct-21 02:52 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TwilightSentinel**:	So on day one it consumes 1, then none on day two, 1 on day three, none on days four or five, and back to the start.


[24-Oct-21 02:59 PM] ApexChat#8127
**CptWaffles**:	aaah okay thanks ! Was wondering if I made a costly mistake but turns out that it wasnt so bad afterall ! :)

**MadMonk21**:	tax money goes to the Governor, currently Rubicate


[11-Nov-21 12:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MadMonk21**:	he puts that money towards infrastructure and upkeep for the buildings here on the planet to help population growth and happiness


[11-Nov-21 12:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MadMonk21**:	corps are basically groups of people who work together


[11-Nov-21 12:11 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MadMonk21**:	a lot of times corps will have lower prices for their members, and often try to work together and help each other out


[11-Nov-21 12:11 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MadMonk21**:	corps can also build corp projects that potentially help their members out too

Study: Ship Crews Re-Directed 28% of the Time
An analysis by the Center For Galactic Studies shows that, on 28% of all industrial ship flights, the crew isn’t sure why they are even going that way. The study gathered data from hundreds of flight crews, who all gave a consistent picture of pointless turnarounds and empty cargo holds. One pilot, who wished to remain anonymous, told the follow...

[25-Jan-22 03:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Rubicate**:	People of Montem! A new and upgraded tax system is soon arriving to this game. It will allow us to tax different type of workers (pioneers, settlers, etc) differently. The natural first thought to this is to tax higher level workers a higher rate, as their infrastructure buildings and upkeep costs a lot more.


[25-Jan-22 03:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Rubicate**:	However, the higher level workers are so outnumbered by the lower tier workers that even with a very high tax rate they will still not be able to provide a genuine dent in the tax income we take in. Pioneers outnumber Technicians about 35:1, yet the highest I can increase technician tax rate is x3 of what we have today.


[25-Jan-22 03:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Rubicate**:	Any public opinion or comments on the situation?

**zdaz14**:	So is the Local Market the way to go vs Commodity Exchange to save on Fuel Costs? Pro license for that right?


[10-Apr-22 12:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SHOTFUN**:	yea, if you are trying to save on fuel, shipping contracts are very good. With how often people go to the CX (commodity exchange) your stuff is almost guaranteed to get picked up


[10-Apr-22 12:11 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SHOTFUN**:	also, if you ever need to move something yourself, you can pick some up to ease the fuel cost


[10-Apr-22 12:11 PM] ApexChat#8127
**zdaz14**:	I saw that. Is there a fair price to pay for hauling goods? Like X per ton? I was throwing together an excel doc and the fuel costs are one of the big things I noticed


[10-Apr-22 12:11 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SHOTFUN**:	usually I throw up 5 NCC/max (either weight or volume, whichever is greater) for a trip to the CX or back


[10-Apr-22 12:11 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SHOTFUN**:	if you are trying to ship to another system (say Benton) it's a little more complicated and I just kinda wing it


[10-Apr-22 12:11 PM] ApexChat#8127

**SHOTFUN**:	there are no requirements for that

**Ephemarel**:	Nah, Dipster is right tho. For all the newbies joining, typing RAT.NC1 into a chat gives you a quick look at the last price RAT was sold at on the respective cx (exchange), and thus a good idea of what the demand is. Given the massive influx of players, several players preempted the accompanying high demand, as he said, and are attempting to profit off of it. (I largely did not participate in this, and simply held off on selling what I've produced the last couple weeks instead.)


[21-Apr-22 11:31 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Ephemarel**:	It would indeed be a smart move for most players to hold out or produce some RATs themselves rather than pay the high prices in MOR right now, but for newbies with so little capital to throw around right now (esp on Montem where it doesn't make sense to use all of their starting money on food machinery), they have less options.

[25-Apr-22 10:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Jornix**:	is it possible to be self sufficient production wise, or the planet constructs dont allow it


[25-Apr-22 10:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Dipster**:	depends on what you're making


[25-Apr-22 10:39 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Dipster**:	on this planet you can be fully self sufficient with DW, RAT, COF, BSE, BBH


[25-Apr-22 10:39 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Dipster**:	for OVE, PWO, BTA, BDE you need to import hydrogen for PE


[25-Apr-22 10:40 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Dipster**:	just because you can be self sufficient doesn't mean it's a good idea, you need to consider operating costs and opportunity cost (what if I sell these materials instead of using them as inputs for myself)


[25-Apr-22 10:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Dipster**:	but for heavy/bulky stuff that's hard to transport it's usually a good tradeoff


[25-Apr-22 10:41 AM] ApexChat#8127

[27-Apr-22 01:19 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Bobemor**:	This COGC vote is literally a great example of how short term planning and inability to cooperate leads to losses for everyone. Prisoners dilemma if you will.


[27-Apr-22 01:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Bobemor**:	Everyone knows they'll be better suited long run individually by a specialised COGC. But they're concerned that short term it might impact them negativity so vote for continuity.


[27-Apr-22 01:21 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Bobemor**:	Montem should be CHEM or CONS, PIO is a bad choice that just reduces the efficiency and therefore productivity and profit of all of NEO space.


[27-Apr-22 01:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shadowsneak**:	Thank you for the wise words Bobemor <3


[27-Apr-22 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**IDKanything**:	if more people voted for CONS, I would willingly throw my 300 pioneers to vote that because why not... but idts CHEM would be a good idea with all these new players


[27-Apr-22 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shadowsneak**:	maybe next week we will see construction and chem at the top of the list


[27-Apr-22 01:28 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Rubicate**:	Everybody should vote for what they think is the best for themselves and Montem, but I do agree that specialization is a powerful option. Consider carefully


[27-Apr-22 01:32 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Bobemor**:	CHEM with Danakil as CONS makes huge sense for Neo as a region and huge sense for new players.


[27-Apr-22 01:32 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Bobemor**:	The thing people overlook is that COGCs speed up input consumption. Whilst often decreasing input production if moving to specialised. This drives up price.


[27-Apr-22 01:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Bobemor**:	People selling LST on Montem won't be voting for PIO or RES, they'll be voting for something that using their inputs (like CHEM) as that leads to the most profit for them.


[27-Apr-22 01:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TheDoctor1786**:	Interesting point you make - I almost wonder if the 10% increase from a non specialized COGC is worth less in increased quantity produced (which also drops the value) than you'd get from 25% on a specific industry that uses you as an input


[27-Apr-22 01:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shadowsneak**:	As other industries consume more LST and less is produced, prices will naturally rise too


[27-Apr-22 01:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TheDoctor1786**:	Just look at Vallis - FEO went through the roof rather quickly as soon as it switched to metallurgy


[27-Apr-22 01:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**shadowsneak**:	both chem and const would drife this


[27-Apr-22 01:37 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Bobemor**:	Some people could counter this by saying its bad for CHEM users then. However, they're now producing far more much more efficiently. The total output of 25% is higher than 10% ultimately. Growth in PrUn is measured by productivity ultimately.


[27-Apr-22 01:38 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TheDoctor1786**:	Also Chem consumable cost is much higher

**Bobemor**:	Specialisation is also often best for people indirectly. Chemistry is definitely slightly more niche than Construction, but that's partly its attraction, it does very good on Montem. [04-May-22 03:27 PM] ApexChat#8127
**IDKanything**:	do note https://handbook.apex.prosperousuniverse.com/wiki/efficiency-factors/#worker-availability

{Embed}
https://handbook.apex.prosperousuniverse.com/wiki/efficiency-factors/
Efficiency factors :: Prosperous Universe Wiki
Prosperous Universe Wiki


[04-May-22 03:27 PM] ApexChat#8127
**IDKanything**:	If Capacity is smaller than Required, the efficiency of all Production Lines requiring the respective type of workforce is impacted negatively. More precisely, the efficiency is multiplied with the percentage of workers available, i.e.: Efficiency x (Population Size / Required)


[04-May-22 03:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**edpovi**:	Yeah, I noticed that. Would be great to use *exactly* the 20 spare workers I have at the moment..  Need to build another HB1 and PP1 to be closer to the correct balance...

[13-Jun-22 10:28 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Farrent**:	if you run the command MS OT-580 on an empty buffer you can see an interactive map of the system


[13-Jun-22 10:30 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Farrent**:	the orbits of the planets are simulated, so sometimes the station and montem are right next to each other, sometimes they are on other sides of the sun


[13-Jun-22 10:31 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Farrent**:	since you don't have drag in space, if you burn the same amount of fuel over a changing distance, the only thing that changes is the travel time

[26-Jun-22 03:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**PMRV**:	There's no contracts you can send directly to another player.  Either you're both online when you post the ad, so the other party can snatch it immediately or you can prearrange contracts.


[26-Jun-22 03:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**PMRV**:	E.g. with my shippers I negotiate a rate in DM, this many NCC for this many shipments.  Then they post a LM ad to sell a DW for that amount and I post shipping ads for 1NCC.  No other player would take these contracts since they are unfavorable on their own.

[31-Jul-22 07:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Lovehungusall**:	Rubi I understand that you want a healthy market for PoPI goods on the CX but the issue is those items aren't bought regularly but in large batches. People who care to be competitive won't go into an item that doesn't sell all that much or they can't afford to have an item sit on the CX for long periods of time when they can make something else that sells faster with a bit lower profit margin. PE.NC1 and MCG.NC1 are good examples for BMP which OFF/STR/SUN share.


[31-Jul-22 07:17 PM] ApexChat#8127

[03-Aug-22 11:31 AM] ApexChat#8127
**irTungsten**:	Parts demand will now peak, as everybody wants those components, this demand will trigger high prices and those high prices will get the whole product chain up and running


[03-Aug-22 11:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**irTungsten**:	that supply will then reduce the price to more affordable levels. The economic cobweb on the supply-demand chart has started its first thread


[03-Aug-22 11:40 AM] ApexChat#8127
**irTungsten**:	https://www.economicshelp.org/blog/glossary/cobweb-theory/

{Embed}
https://www.economicshelp.org/blog/glossary/cobweb-theory/
Cobweb theory - Economics Help
Definition, explanation and diagrams of Cobweb models. - The idea that price fluctuations can cause a cycle of rising and falling prices.
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/BW19DawezOatga57EVE_sxx3EA_rUaparF_OPfgUGPU/https/www.economicshelp.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/cobweb-increasing-volatility-price.png

[18-Sep-22 03:04 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Lovehungusall**:	I'll answer point 1. There really isn't a reason to tax Pio/Set differently. You aren't magically getting more profits from SET buildings compared to PIO and they roughly cost the same. On the PoPI side of things they don't consume more need than PIO when you account for population sizes. They use the same 2 items for growth (Safety and Health) and don't need an extra building to provide for them.

**Ditchbuster**:	when you want a new base, is there something to buy or do you just need to bring all the prefabs needed?


[14-Oct-22 06:49 PM] ApexChat#8127
***Daeryx** joined.*


[14-Oct-22 07:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
***sh901** joined.*


[14-Oct-22 08:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Dinglebop**:	@Ditchbuster - you just need to bring the fabs required for whatever buildings you're planning on building. That said, you need to take into account the building materials for the Core Module (CM). That is the first building that needs to built for any base, and requires 12 PSL, 4 LDE, 4 LTA, 4 LSE, 12 TRU, and the relevant construction materials (MCG, HSE, AEF, INS, etc.)


[14-Oct-22 08:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Dinglebop**:	*8 TRU


[14-Oct-22 08:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ditchbuster**:	ok thanks! that explains why i couldnt find a CM to buy.


[14-Oct-22 08:12 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Dinglebop**:	I had the same issue/question ;P. Only variable to take into account is the construction materials. You can  look on the community tools site to find out how to calculate the necessary materials or you can look at the materials for the CM by clicking 'start base' after opening a new buffer: 'PLI {desired planet}'

[20-Oct-22 12:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
***Grevias** joined.*


[20-Oct-22 01:26 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Dinglebop**:	Gotta respond... I dont think everyone who is pro-chem here believes that Montem is an "ideal" planet as far as on-site resources goes. LST for FLX is a very minor benefit, with Vallis right there, but the resources on Montem are largely besides the point. For me, the main thing is that its in a CX system. Not only is keeping your base supplied relatively easy (importing C, H, HAL, CL, whatever), but because it's in the CX system it's also central to almost everywhere else you go. If you wanted to start another base somewhere else, there's a fair chance you'd be able to integrate your montem chem products straight into your new chain.


[20-Oct-22 01:35 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Dinglebop**:	I don't think that the argument that it doesn't serve newer players well doesn't make much sense either. Part of that argument, that i've heard at least, is that your first stop is at the settler level, and people seem to think that that's already unattainable. To counter that, you could simply argue that CHPs only require bfabs, and thus the actual barrier to entry is the same as any other PIO building. In fact, everyone who decides to start on katoa needs to do exactly that - build a REF (settler level) and start refining. At least with chem you're able to diversify quickly and easily (once you get the hang of the UI and such). In fact, once you realize (as everyone does) that lfabs are not out of reach, even at the start, you're able to build a POL, also at the settler level (taking advantage of your already  built infrastructure) with the added cost of *just* LBHs, the cheapest Lfab.


[20-Oct-22 01:45 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Dinglebop**:	I think the other side of the argument, the "why not switch Montem and Danakil" side, is a bit more complicated. I think it begs the question - "why is a COGC good?" A COGC is a way to pump a specific set of products out faster, at a pretty comparable profit margin. It does increase profitability slightly, but that's only because workforce consumables become a fractionally lesser proportion of the COGS. The COGC benefits the population as a whole the most when the benefit can be applied over a range of products. Meaning the CONS COGC should not be designed solely for PP1 production, which it seems is the current argument to put it on Montem. Most fabs on the market do not require FE, and a large portion of the bfabs currently on the market were produced with AL.


[20-Oct-22 01:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Dinglebop**:	I don't know exactly what the specific arguments were to put construction on Danakil, but I can assume that at least a part of it was that 1-jump FTL flight time from MOR/Vallis to Danakil is much more consistent than STL flight from MOR/Vallis to Montem, which is something that you'd want to consider when shipping heavier products


[20-Oct-22 01:50 AM] ApexChat#8127
***Dinglebop** deleted this message.*


[20-Oct-22 01:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Dinglebop**:	Overall, if I were to sum up how I view it: "Why would it be better to put a pure CONS COGC on a planet with the base resources required, when a large portion of the population would need to fill extraction and SMELTING needs to feed it?" If the goal is to reduce bfab prices in MOR, that might make sense. Otherwise, I don't really get the arguments against chem

**Prradox**:	is it viable to try to both mine your own resources and then produce items from them? [21-Jan-23 10:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Prradox**:	like would it take 2 bases, or could I theoretically have an extractor and a BMP in a single base? Is it the planet itself that reduces the output of 1 or the other preventing dual-purpose bases?


[21-Jan-23 10:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	Specialized bases are better. If you never ever want to pay, you'll be limited in the number of bases you can have.


[21-Jan-23 10:33 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Prradox**:	Thank you for your response Yawnder.


[21-Jan-23 10:34 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Prradox**:	Is there a way to automate (or semi automate) the transfer/production of goods via contracts between my bases if I upgrade to pro? The contract system might allow for that if I could sign both sides of the contract with my different bases, but I'd wager a guess that isn't allowed/implemented?


[21-Jan-23 10:35 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	You can't automate. There is no mechanism to do so, and if you were to make a bot (which is possible) it's against the ToS.


[21-Jan-23 10:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Prradox**:	ahh ok, I won't investigate that further then :P


[21-Jan-23 10:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	So to transfer goods, you either move it with your ship, or make a shipping contract (if you have PRO)


[21-Jan-23 10:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Prradox**:	and that's the "ads" I hear people asking for when they're making CX trips? A contract for them to pickup/ship my goods to my warehouse at the CX?


[21-Jan-23 10:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	Yes. You can only make ads (on the LM, Local Market) if you have PRO.


[21-Jan-23 10:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	You can ACCEPT contracts if you're BASIC though.


[21-Jan-23 10:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Prradox**:	ok cool, thanks again, I'll stop bugging ya now :)


[21-Jan-23 10:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	(Basic, not Free)


[21-Jan-23 10:38 AM] ApexChat#8127

[21-Jan-23 10:52 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	The best way to "Do everything without the CX" is to join a corp. So corpmate can supply the LST to your BMP for example, while your farm corp mate supplies you with food want water and you pay them back in BMP products like OVE and PWO etc


[21-Jan-23 10:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	There are multiple hurdles to doing lots of things yourself, the number of experts you can have and the planet COGC focus.


[21-Jan-23 10:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	Even if you are going against the COGC, you still are limited by the number of experts so if you are extracting and manufacturing, you at best can split the experts, but that's worse than having full dedication to a specific industry

[21-Jan-23 04:58 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Jetic**:	any resources on how to analyse price charts for like 2-3 items? i started as a CONSTR and need to understand price movements


[21-Jan-23 04:59 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	What do you mean? They are standard candlestick charts


[21-Jan-23 04:59 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	But trying to predict movements in this game is not really easy


[21-Jan-23 05:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	A lot of the changes are from entirely unpredictable events


[21-Jan-23 05:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	A player who produced a lot of a good quits - and suddenly demand exceeds the supply.


[21-Jan-23 05:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	A different player sees the spike and 2 weeks later spins up a giant base - and floods the market and 5 weeks later the price is below what it was before....


[21-Jan-23 05:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	So don't see a price going up and think that it'll keep going up forever


[21-Jan-23 05:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	As a constructor you only care about LST and FE prices really, maybe PE if you are doing BDEs and C if you're just making the PE in your BMP...


[21-Jan-23 05:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	In general FE has been stable between 350-450 and LST is likely on an upward trend due to a large producer leaving.


[21-Jan-23 05:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	Right now if I was you, I'd be building extractors assuming you have pro.


[21-Jan-23 05:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Jetic**:	im saving up for my first extractor, building my own stuff for it and have 120 pop to spare for them


[21-Jan-23 05:17 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Jetic**:	i dont have a pro license, however, would i need one of them?


[21-Jan-23 05:17 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	You need one to expand beyond a certain point and to trade directly with players.


[21-Jan-23 05:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	For example, I use a lot of LST. I try to buy it off directly on the planet to avoid going to the CX.


[21-Jan-23 05:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	If you were trying to sell your LST, you'd have to bring it to the CX, which means increasing your price accordingly.


[21-Jan-23 05:19 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	Let's say you want to sell LST with 100 NCC in your pocket. If you sell local, you're fine selling at 100.


[21-Jan-23 05:19 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	If you sell on the CX, you will want 110 or 120 to pay for the transport too.


[21-Jan-23 05:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	Now, let's say I want to buy LST and I'm willing to pay 120 for it. I'll either buy it for 120 locally, or if I have to buy it at the CX, I'll be willing to pay max 100 since I have to transport it.


[21-Jan-23 05:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	(The specific numbers I said are just approximate, but you get the idea.)


[21-Jan-23 05:21 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Yawnder**:	By selling/buying on the LM, or in direct contracts, both the seller and buyer are winning.


[21-Jan-23 05:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Jetic**:	that all makes sense


[21-Jan-23 05:26 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Prradox**:	not to mention the 5h+ trip each way (if you were out of mats to run your plants, that'd be wasted time / lost money)


[21-Jan-23 05:26 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Prradox**:	unless you wasted fuel speeding it up ofc

[21-Jan-23 05:27 PM] ApexChat#8127

[02-Feb-23 07:43 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	Welcome, usually this forum is a little more chatty and always open to helping new players.  Hopefully you have watch the tutorials and unpacked your ship.  Build two pioneer habitats, and check which profession you choose to know which other buildings to build.  At the moment, both carbon production and limestone extraction are very profitable and you can do either even if you selected a different profession.  You can buy goods at the CX but you should rent a warehouse there [100 per week) before you purchase anything (if you don’t you may think your goods have disappeared, they haven’t but it’s a regular issue which can quickly be solved)

[13-Feb-23 01:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Opalesce-Spectrum**:	well, it doesn't always have to be the *lowest* settings. sometimes you can get a reasonably worthwhile speedup for just a tick or two more than minimum, which is easier to be precise with picking if you widen the flight-planning screen. the way it was described to me when I started was, "as fast as you need, but as little as you can manage", which has served me well.


[13-Feb-23 01:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	Yeah "lowest" setting is bad advice really as fuel usage and travel time is not linear. Going min fuel may turn a 10h trip into a 30h trip all to save 500c of fuel


[13-Feb-23 01:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**jankali**:	Yea, I saw that when messing with the slider. exactly lowest doesn't seem like the most economical option if it arriving sooner means you can quickly reimburse the spent fuel cost


[13-Feb-23 01:30 PM] ApexChat#8127
**jankali**:	(i.e. preventing a stalled production or supply shortage is likely worth a bit more than the extra fuel spent going a bit above min)


[13-Feb-23 01:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	Ideally you make as few trips as possible and with a full load every time


[13-Feb-23 01:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**jankali**:	yeap


[13-Feb-23 01:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	But early on you can't do that because you just can't afford to fill your ship with inputs


[13-Feb-23 01:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	so you end up in a dumb situation where you spend 2k fuel to sell 10k worth of stuff


[13-Feb-23 01:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Mordgier**:	The LM can be a massive cost savings early on as a result

**BeBopLula**:	This is Montem, it has LST.  It has some other resources but the only one worth extracting is LST.  You could farm but you will make more money with LST


[13-Feb-23 03:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**JavierZamudio**:	Thanks! so this chat is only for this planet, Montem, right?


[13-Feb-23 03:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	Yes, if you build on other planets you will get access to that planets chat.


[13-Feb-23 03:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**JavierZamudio**:	Thanks ;)


[13-Feb-23 03:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	There is a Global chat and a global help chat


[13-Feb-23 03:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	but if you need help you can ask on and chat and people will help


[13-Feb-23 03:11 PM] ApexChat#8127
**JavierZamudio**:	Got it, tnks ;)


[13-Feb-23 03:15 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	Top tips for starters on Montem.  Extract LST.  Build BMP to turn LST into MCG (buy SIO to do this).  Build PP1 to build PreFabs (you need to buy FE todo this).  Sell the fuel in your second ship for extra money (you don’t need two ships to start with)


[13-Feb-23 03:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**JavierZamudio**:	Thanks a lot bro, i really appreciate it. Ill follow your advice


[13-Feb-23 03:25 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	Look to sell about 50% of what you make to pay for fuel and comsumer goods.  Don’t use everything you make to build your own structures.  You will go bankrupt if you don’t sell stuff


[13-Feb-23 03:26 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	That said there is no shame in having to restart as you learn the game.  Most players have done this once or twice when starting out.


[13-Feb-23 03:28 PM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	Also dont use too much fuel (initially) It takes longer to get to the CX but you then have more money to spend.

[10-Apr-23 10:49 AM] ApexChat#8127
***GroovyGuavaGuy** joined.*


[10-Apr-23 11:03 AM] ApexChat#8127
**GroovyGuavaGuy**:	Hi there, if I take a shipment contract, is it possible to split the shipment in two? I need both of my ships to be able to deliver the contract.


[10-Apr-23 11:52 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Opalesce-Spectrum**:	unfortunately, no, you can't split an existing shipment to divide between ships. but what you *can* do is try to contact the one who issued the contract and ask them to take the shipment back and divide it into parts you can carry in multiple trips. it's an easy mistake to make when you're still learning, but definitely one that you should try to remedy with the contractor up front, because if the contract expires, while you still have the shipment, it doesn't just go back to them, it becomes that in effect you accidentally stole the items, essentially pirating. which I'm sure is not what you're trying to do. just, try to contact the person, explain you're new, not a pirate, and that you'd like to fix the situation. most of us will be understanding and cooperative. =) good luck


[10-Apr-23 11:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Opalesce-Spectrum**:	(unless you didn't take the contract yet and were just asking to check *before* taking it, which I guess you might have been doing)


[10-Apr-23 12:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**GroovyGuavaGuy**:	Thanks for the clarification - I haven't taken the contract yet, wanted to ask beforehand. I sent a message to the contractor to see if they are willing to split the contract in half.


[10-Apr-23 12:21 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Opalesce-Spectrum**:	awesome. ^_^ good luck on that then!


[10-Apr-23 12:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Opalesce-Spectrum**:	love the name by the way :D guava is great

[25-Apr-23 12:33 AM] ApexChat#8127
***Reese101597** joined.*


[25-Apr-23 05:50 AM] ApexChat#8127
***MuttC** joined.*


[25-Apr-23 07:28 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Tardwrangler**:	What is everyone producing that we have Chemisry as the specialty on this planet?


[25-Apr-23 07:34 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Opalesce-Spectrum**:	heh, it's a bit of a long-standing debate here, really. as it's a starting planet, it's meant to be able to specialize in construction and building parts, particularly given the limestone supply. so the specialty for most people here would be best served as either construction or, even better, pioneers. however, the limestone supply is also attractive to more advanced players who want to use it for chemistry, a more advanced industry not generally affordable/accessible to the many newbies that end up here. however, the higher workforce voting power of the few chem players, ends up overpowering the many more players who'd vote for pioneers, but aren't as established so don't have as much voting weight.


[25-Apr-23 07:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**mast3rd3mon**:	I doubt they're doing the LST chem production line as its not very profitable. Ideally we need more of the newer/non chem players to start voting more so we can win COGC as either CONS or PIO


[25-Apr-23 07:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Opalesce-Spectrum**:	it does seem like a lot of people have gotten demoralized about endlessly being outvoted by fewer people, and they stopped bothering to vote at all mostly.


[25-Apr-23 07:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Opalesce-Spectrum**:	"what's the point in bothering to vote, we're just going to lose to the more advanced players anyway" kind of thing


[25-Apr-23 07:38 AM] ApexChat#8127

[05-Jun-23 09:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mnementh**:	And when you have queued the FP, you can fill the farm with stuff you need for RAT. So if you wanna stick with the same recipe you need BEA, VEG and GRN. You can replace GRN with MAI, or VEG with NUT if you want, works the same, but needs different amounts of water to grow and different time.

[05-Jun-23 09:40 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mnementh**:	As you play free, your only option for trade is the CX (Commodity Exchange). The nearest CS is on Moria Station in the same system as Montem. You load the stuff you want to sell on your ship (open the base inventory and the ship cargo and drag the items around) and fly the ship to the station. Then there you can set the items on sale.


[05-Jun-23 09:40 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FireFreak**:	PRO prices: https://prosperousuniverse.com/premium/

{Embed}
https://prosperousuniverse.com/premium/
Prosperous Universe | The Economic Space MMO
In Prosperous Universe, you are the CEO of your own spacefaring company. Explore the galaxy, design spaceships, forge alliances, and most importantly: produce, trade, transport, and profit. Manage your business through a highly customizable user interface named APEX, accessible via web browser. Contribute to a purely player-driven MMO economy in...
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/iw6GWFhfbXVxv9pGxGE1JgF_0dDoqQLVZGppgAEL7-U/https/prosperousuniverse.com/og/image.jpg


[05-Jun-23 09:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Mnementh**:	And yes, PRO options allow you to access local market and direct contracts.

[06-Jun-23 06:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	Alright, after some deliberation, I'm hereby announcing my candidacy for the Montem governor position. SWHY's a mid-level company with a focus on Verdant-based consumables industry, and I admittedly only recently moved into Montem to begin with, and I have no experience governing planets whatsoever, but I'm pretty decent with excel spreadsheets, and are *way* too active in the game for my own good.  So if you vote for me, you'll get:  - A young, inexperienced, upstart, but also very motivated and active governor  - who'll spreadsheet the heck out of the planet's finances to ensure that POPI needs are exactly where they need to be, with the minimum of taxes required to finance them  - A focus on ensuring that the planet has the necessary workforce of technicians & engineers to reliably support mid-tier industries (not sure we need scientists here, yet)  - A public referendum on whether a welfare program should be established that funnels tax revenue into providing <90d companies cheaper


[06-Jun-23 06:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	(Also, do feel free to check out the Montem channels on the UFO discord, long, formatted texts are WAY more readable there)

[06-Jun-23 07:06 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	@SolarAspect The previous (and long-term!) governeur of Montem, Rubicate, has announced that he'll put down the office and will not run again. Governeurs manage a planets POPI (population infrastructure), that is responsible for generating your workers, paying for upkeep via production taxes and such. All players with a base on a planet get 1 vote (with elections being held every months or so) to pick who should be the next governeur.


[06-Jun-23 07:06 AM] ApexChat#8127
**SolarAspect**:	If you make production taxes lower @Alblaka I'd be so happy, already buying commodities is really expensive, and production cost isn't helping at all


[06-Jun-23 07:07 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	The voting is done in the ADM center of Montem (ADM OT-580b). You can also bring up the screen by opening up the Planet Info (PLI OT-580b) and then clicking 'Planetary Administration Center' at the bottom. The election starts in 2 days.


[06-Jun-23 07:09 AM] ApexChat#8127

[06-Jun-23 07:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	I can't promise you a production tax cut without knowing how the planet's internal finances look like. I'll also point out that production taxes generally make up ~1-2% of your overall production costs. Slightly more for primary industries (i.e. LST extraction). But yes, consumable prices for T1 are way too high. That's what my last policy point is meant to adress. It's not an issue for older (or even mid-players like me), but if you're just starting out, RATs @ 130 is a lot of bound capital.

[06-Jun-23 03:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	MMs are an absolute necessarity at universe start, but their fixed-price nature becomes a distorting factor at some point. We also can't really NOT have MMs for higher tier products, or there would be no real developement. The game needs some kind of goal that isn't just capital, that incentivizes production of high tier goods. I could imagine Elite Dangerous style community events would work. Devs hold a semi-RP open forum on galactic issues, the community decides to build a new CX, the devs put up a list of high tier goods needed to complete it and add a basic contribution menu for that inter-planetary project.


[06-Jun-23 04:30 PM] ApexChat#8127

[06-Jun-23 05:42 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	The aid for the starting players lies in not allowing large players to freely print money, whilst giving them something else to do. Global research would be interesting, too. Unlocking new buildinds and recipes, and then being able to sell licenses for that technology, as it slowly ticks up to become commonly available. Allowing mid and late game players to focus on RnD bases to get an innovative edge, without making research strictly mandatory, nor excluding non-corp players from meaningful competition


[06-Jun-23 05:48 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	The alternative to minimizing inflation (or incentivizing deflation) would be to progressively increase the player starting capital... I'm not sure there is much else that can be done, mechanically to aid new players in finding a footing in a well-developed economy. Except player-driven actions, such as providing newer players low/no interest loans, cheaper consumables etc.

[09-Jun-23 06:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	Masterdemon promised to null taxes for Manufacturing, Construction adn Ressource Extraction in the Pioneer tier. But that's less than a 1% cost reduction because i.e. BMPs will cost 40 NCC in taxes (currently) and >4000 NCC in inputs + consumables. So he's promising a tax cut that is utterly irrelevant even to new players 'to help new players'. I'm making no such polittalk, but instead will focus on streamlining the expenses of the planet (mostly upkeep for public infrastructures (='POPI', which provide the workforce), and figuring out a way to provide cheaper consumables to new players. Because THAT's where the costs for new players actually lie. RATs for 130/u is pretty pricy, if you can reasonably print them for 60/u.

**Alblaka**:	@dezo: Governeurs can adjust taxes, and have some options for bringing new workers onto a planet... but mostly their job is to use the tax income to pay for upkeep of the various planetary buildings, like POPI and COGC.

**SolarAspect**:	Is starting off as a metallurgist then branching out into construction really efficient? I am currently mining my own iron and limestone and producing any other materials I need in a BMP then feeding it into a PP1.


[12-Jun-23 07:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Lhokee**:	You will be surprised. And the travel time is usually less than Montem to MOR or VAL. Having the CoGC bonus is amazing for your production times


[12-Jun-23 07:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Lhokee**:	Push your Metallurgy out to Vallis (CoGC bonus plus you extract FE at 14 instead of 8), your Construction to Danakil, and just use the LST on Montem for FLX (that is also CoGC bunus and you need it for your SME anyway) and things will start picking up nicely


[12-Jun-23 08:11 PM] ApexChat#8127

[13-Jun-23 02:51 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	Given their account age, 'just make 3 seperate bases' is not exactly sound advice :P For now, they should focus on RoI, which usually means filling out your base witha preferably contained production chain. No need to start with multi-base longterm efficiency-optimization before you can afford a CM.


[13-Jun-23 02:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	So, @SolarAspect Montems FEO deposit is lackluster, it's LST deposit is average, but you can definitely still do construction, and avoid all the hassle of shipping heavy material. But do keep an eye on whether importing materials and slapping down another PP1 might be more profitable than running 1 PP1 less whilst making your own inputs.

[14-Jun-23 01:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Alblaka**:	I'll second the "it depends". There's no strict answer, because next to all the factors going in (i.e. efficiency, recipe, market prices) there's also the question of 'how does worth mean to you'; is it raw profit? Reliable profit? Overall production throughput? Resilence against market influence? Area efficiency?


[14-Jun-23 03:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SolarAspect**:	I personally use flux, but I do not produce it myself. For me, the reason why I use it is it's simply more efficient. Since I am both in the metallurgy and construction business, Iron is one of my base products for producing construction materials like BBH and BSE.


[14-Jun-23 03:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**SolarAspect**:	I use a lot of iron so the more iron I can produce in a short amount of time, the better. Also, if there is an excess amount of Iron, I can simply either sell it or make steel and sell it for a higher profit. Hope this helps :)

[23-Jun-23 03:26 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DerJacques**:	@BlackAnthrax sorry for the late reply. I chose the "Constructor" start. Wondering if I should try to move some Iron or Limestone myself, instead of buying it on the CX..


[23-Jun-23 03:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
***Acetone** joined.*


[23-Jun-23 03:34 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	I'm crunching some numbers for you now @Derjacques so I can give you a more exact idea, but at first glance I think I'd suggest buying the materials for an HB1 and an EXT and digging out LST. Then importing FE and SIO from the CX to produce a 2xBBH/1xBSE mix on your PP1 and MCG on your BMP.


[23-Jun-23 03:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	FEO output isn't exactly fantastic here, and then you'd also need to sink for a smelter to get it into a useable condition, while the LST will be useable across both your other production buildings as soon as it comes out of the dirt.


[23-Jun-23 03:36 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DerJacques**:	Those are fantastic insights. Thanks a lot! I'll go down that route.


[23-Jun-23 03:42 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Ok, crunched the numbers. Assuming you can get RAT @110, DW@95, OVE@115, COF@650, PWO@285, FE@550, and SIO@85, you'll make about 5700-6K in profit per day with 2 construction experts after adding an EXT and HB1. You should be able to get those materials for those prices (or better, I priced a tad high). Later on, once you've grown a bit, you can begin exporting to HRT CX and buying cheaper upkeep materials to bring back with you.


[23-Jun-23 03:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	FE price is the one most likely to start rising again and bite you in the backside. If it does, I'd just slide more PP1 production over to BSE's to limit your exposure to FE prices. LST is in fairly plentiful supply right now and should be easy enough to source at decent rates if you have to start importing it.


[23-Jun-23 03:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DerJacques**:	That is so helpful. Thanks a ton! I really appreciate it. I can already tell that I'll have to set up my own little Excel sheets soon.


[23-Jun-23 03:48 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Technically, you could probably make "more" building another BMP or PP1 instead of an EXT, but logistics is always something to keep in mind. And LST and FE are heavy, so by having your own LST source you significantly reduce the number of trips you need to make to the CX, and gas is money.


[23-Jun-23 03:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DerJacques**:	Got it. Sounds like a great plan to me. I'm sourcing the materials for the EXT and HB1 now. Thanks again for your help!


[23-Jun-23 03:55 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Np. I'd offer to sell to a high bid on the CX to help you out....but I'm primarily based around Hortus, and all my materials are warehoused there.


[23-Jun-23 03:58 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Speaking of, a quick note. Make your shopping list early and put in bids for everything immediately. Pretty good chance no one will sell to you, but if they do, you save some money. If they don't, you can just cancel the bids once you get to the CX and then buy from the asks


[23-Jun-23 04:02 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Also, if anyone needs anything transported to the CX (and have a PRO or BASIC account) let me know. Departing for the CX with a WCB in 15 or 20 minutes.


[23-Jun-23 04:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**DerJacques**:	That all makes sense. Thanks!

***CyberLyon** left.*


[28-Jun-23 07:04 PM] ApexChat#8127
**alienasa**:	what's a ghost slot?


[28-Jun-23 07:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Planets only physically have room for so many bases. However, if a planet is a starter planet, infinite numbers of new players are allowed to select it for their first base. So once the planet is full, no existing players can put a base there. When a new player selects it and it's full, it creates a ghost plot. No existing player can place a base here until enough players leave to remove all ghost plots and empty out some of the regular ones.


[28-Jun-23 07:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**alienasa**:	mmmm, interesting. I'm probably one of the4m :D


[28-Jun-23 07:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Montem "had" been getting to where existing players were able to set down new bases here again. Then the huge influx of players over the last couple days quickly snowed it back under again, ol

[05-Jul-23 11:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Just popping in. Farming, on a scale of "Wretched" to "Great" comes in at around a "Bad". There are definitely worse, but there are MANY better.


[05-Jul-23 11:28 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Fertility is a modifier to production speed. The baseline is 0%, many planets have a positive modifier to production speed. This one is negative.


[05-Jul-23 11:31 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	And while you might just think "Producing a little slower isn't a big deal", keep in mind that not only does it directly reduce your profits (by reducing the number of profitable goods you knock out per day), it also directly increases the cost to produce a unit of goods, as it increases the cost of worker consumables and building repairs per unit produced. So you make less of it, and each unit makes you less money.


[05-Jul-23 11:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pwnce_de_Leon**:	That's a good point


[05-Jul-23 11:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pwnce_de_Leon**:	Perhaps I'll just look more into taking advantage of the chem bonus here


[05-Jul-23 11:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Yeah, that's a huge part about stacking efficiency bonuses as high as you can get them. Not simply because you produce "more" of something, but because the actual cost to produce decreases.


[05-Jul-23 11:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Efficiency of scale is very much a thing.


[05-Jul-23 11:33 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Pwnce_de_Leon**:	Thanks for the tips!


[05-Jul-23 11:34 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Keep in mind the entry chem building is a CHP. While you "can" run it with just Pioneers, it'll be "very" slow, although at least in that case the consumables cost decreases in direct relation to the slowdown since you're just outright not employing the settlers.


[05-Jul-23 11:35 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	POL's are actually probably more efficiency with just PIO's (28% vs 25%) but the buy in cost is significantly higher.

[05-Jul-23 12:46 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	I mean, I have a basically identical set up, it's just spread across 5 planets. Have 5 planets in a tight little 3 system span. One mines HAL/LST/FEO. HAL goes to a chem world where CL/PG/EPO/TCL are made. PG/TCL go to a manufacturing world where NL/KV is made. The aforementioned FEO gets shipped down to a smelting world (where I also mine ALO), then the FE/AL/STL from the smelting world go to construction rock along with the NL/KV from the manufacturing world and the EPO from the chem. The whole lot is within 1 jump either way of the construction world. Then I have an O tap 2 away for feeding the smelters and making STL. That's 3 of the planets I built from scratch.

[06-Jul-23 02:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	I guess my only question for you is, do you actually have the personal funding, or a guaranteed backer to provide funding for the planets upkeep. While the astronomical sums run up building new POPI in the last term is anything but the normal expenditure….it is still a significant expense, and you won’t see much in the way of tax income until 7-14 days after you take the big seat.


[06-Jul-23 02:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Specifically because corporate collected tax is only remitted at the end of periods, and any jobs started before the change of government will still pay to the previous government.


[06-Jul-23 02:09 PM] ApexChat#8127

[14-Jul-23 08:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MemoryAlpha**:	getting pio/set unemployment down to <10% while maintaining tech+ will save a ton of upkeep


[14-Jul-23 08:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Not really, since the only way that educating upwards saves upkeep is by moving employees to higher tiers. By definition the higher tiers consume far more upkeep, since fully half of a pioneer is paid for by the infinite life support need.


[14-Jul-23 08:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	The higher unemployment forced happiness down, which slows/stops immigration into the planet. There is no natural immigration in the higher tiers. So pushing pops to higher tiers reduces unemployment, which increases immigration, and increases the upkeep average per pop.


[14-Jul-23 08:56 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MemoryAlpha**:	you can clearly see the imbalance in pop unemployment. keeping it minimal across tiers will be less


[14-Jul-23 08:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	If you shift 10K employees up a tier, all you've done is increase the cost to care for those 10K employees, and by reducing the unemployment encouraged further immigration by raising happiness (happiness is suppressed by high unemployment), so unless you have some plan to vent population somewhere along the lines, all you're accomplishing by uptiering is increasing immigration and average per pop upkeep.


[14-Jul-23 08:58 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Frankly, a ludicrously high pioneer unemployment is almost a good thing, since it completely stops new immigration, and paying for THEIR upkeep is damn near free since 50% of it is paid for free, and the rest comes out of safety/health which is cheap to generate


[14-Jul-23 08:59 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MemoryAlpha**:	not on a planet like this. the pio/set are where most the upkeep is going


[14-Jul-23 09:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	I'm just stating a literal fact, a settler consumes more than a pioneer. A technician consumes more than a settler. An engineer consumed more than a technician. A scientist consumes more than an engineer. Regardless of where the majority of the upkeep is spent, higher tiers consume more. Uptiering saves nothing unless you have somehow managed a targetted happiness suppression somewhere along the line (with overwhelming unemployment usually) to vent them.


[14-Jul-23 09:01 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	1 is not greater than 2, no matter how many different ways you look at it.

**Opalesce-Spectrum**:	just to add a bit of context to the (admittedly mild, but still) bashing of those bothered by the chem cogc status: it's not really that the chem people are a majority. it's just that most people gave up bothering to vote for anything else anymore when no matter what they do they're outvoted. understand that while the vote for governor is one player, one vote, the voting weight for the cogc is much different, and based on your worker population/types. there have been several votes in the past where the actual number of players voting for pioneers was basically double the number of players voting for chem, but because so many of those voting for pioneers were newbies (because yes, this *is* a starter planet, and pioneers is the cogc that would benefit them the most at that point), their worker pop weight was nothing compared to the established, much wealthier players who could have just a handful of them come together and outweigh everyone else easily.

**Alblaka**:	I'd recommen going for CHPs early. They are VERY cheap to build, cheaper than some T1 buildings even. You'll need to invest some money for the T2 consumables of the settlers, but the CHP will print you  pretty penny and has a rather versatile list of recipes to work with. Don't bother with 'higher tier chem' for the fist couple months though. It's a massive cost to entry, and low RoI

[28-Jul-23 10:27 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Basically, BSE's have been capped against the upper market maker for quite some time now. So as the price of inputs go up, the profits from making BSE's continues to drop, because the price mechanically can't go any higher.


[28-Jul-23 10:27 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	I've been doing well with Bfab production at my starter base for my first 30 days. Been expanding production actually.


[28-Jul-23 10:28 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	They're still profitable to produce, for now, they just COULD make more money if they weren't artificially price caped.


[28-Jul-23 10:28 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	Oh ok, so there is a Market Maker I haven't dug into yet that caps prices on some things.


[28-Jul-23 10:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Yes, some things have an AI market maker, like DW, RAT, etc. Then some things have a faux market maker where the AI is just on one side of the equation, either buying or selling, but not both.


[28-Jul-23 10:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	BSE's are capped at....1550 I think.


[28-Jul-23 10:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	There's a literally infinite supply of them from the AI at that price, so nothing over that can be sold on the CX

[31-Jul-23 09:38 AM] ApexChat#8127

You just need to drop a new CoGC if you want to be competitive with the people already on a CoGC. I've already dropped 3 of them myself.

[03-Aug-23 02:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Honestly, construction is more or less pants on head here. You have a problem, as it were. In order to vertically stack construction in situ (which is what people really want), you need resource extraction, metallurgy, and construction. In the grand scheme of things, metallurgy or construction are both of relatively equal value if you're doing a fully vertically stacked set up. Vallis is also a starter planet, and MUCH better at producing the iron you need. LST really isn't a big deal to move around in the quantities you need for construction. So you either have TWO planets in the same system that are roughly equally as good at construction. Eventually, you could horizontally chain into dedicated metallurgy and construction bases, but if you have the shipping throughput to ship both iron AND limestone, you can just as easily horizontally integrate from vallis into danakil. So Chem is here because there's no reason to have 2 planets in the same system doing essentially the same thing.


[03-Aug-23 02:48 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	So we have 2 planets doing two different things, and you can horizontally integrate into Danakil if that's your schtick later on.


[03-Aug-23 02:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Which means FEO gets pulled and smelted on Vallis and consumed in situ. LST gets pulled from here and used in situ in chemistry, or shipped over to Vallis. And when you're ready to ship out "everything" for a horizontally integrated construction experience, you go to Danakil.


[03-Aug-23 02:53 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Although, frankly, Danakil is intended for higher tier PP3/PP4 construction. Hence the hordes of TEC's and ENG's there, and the 0% ENG unemployment. Because only an absolute knucklehead ships around raw iron for horizontal integration. Which goes back to the vertically integrated PP1 experience, where metallurgy and construction are of equal value....and Vallis is just plain better at that.

[04-Aug-23 03:52 PM] ApexChat#8127

[04-Aug-23 03:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	So if there "wasn't" IDC/EDC and other assorted "cash printers" the game would have had it's cash supply fly up it's own backside. Especially since there are a MULTITUDE of valves removing currency from the game at all times.


[04-Aug-23 04:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	Zuul I feel like you should just have an entry on the website of how the game works to avoid anyone making the mistake of thinking otherwise


[04-Aug-23 04:16 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	That's not how the "game works". That's how an economy works. If the supply of material goods increases, but the cash supply remains static, then there is deflation. Similarly, if the supply of goods remains static, but the cash supply increases, you have inflation.


[04-Aug-23 04:17 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	And if the supply of material goods increases, and god forbid somehow "decreases" (in our case, because there are outflow valves), then you have an absolutely WICKED amount of deflation.


[04-Aug-23 04:17 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	erm, cash supply decreases, that is

**ArcturusRex**:	Can anyone enlighten me why there is such a huge demand for Nutrient Solution? Does it all go into coffee? Are mushrooms and algae profitable? Is there some other secret recipe which uses NS?


[10-Aug-23 10:45 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Volume vs input cost. A planet will with HYF's can produce more RAT fodder than multiple planets stacked with FRM's.


[10-Aug-23 10:45 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	erm, planet with HYF's. It's late and I'm tired, lol


[10-Aug-23 10:46 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ArcturusRex**:	ah, I see. That calculation isn't obvious from PRUNplanner


[10-Aug-23 10:48 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Well, look at ALG. ALG effectively replaces BEA. BEA you get 10 per day on 30 area at base speeds. ALG is 53 per 30 area on base speeds.


[10-Aug-23 10:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Or VEG is at least apples to apples. That's roughly 60 per day compared to 9, or something like that.


[10-Aug-23 10:52 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ArcturusRex**:	interesting


[10-Aug-23 10:52 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	There is something to be said for continuing to grow GRN on FRM's if you can manage it, since, while MAI does output more volume out of a HYF, it's not a massively stupid difference like protein/triglyceride ingredients


[10-Aug-23 10:53 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Long story short though, 500 area of a HYF base will handily outproduce a 1K FRM base, and that would even be true on Prom where the FRM's are getting a nice fertility bonus and the HYF's are not.


[10-Aug-23 10:54 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	On the flipside, HYF's don't give a damn about bad fertility...or none at all. You can grow on whatever god forsaken hellhole you please.

[11-Aug-23 06:03 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Strake**:	It's important to keep in mind that the HYF vs FRM comparison depends a lot on where you are at in your empire. The HYF can do way more per space per day, but it also takes ridiculous amounts of water compared to the farm which is a logistics problem you might not be set up to deal with yet


[11-Aug-23 06:04 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Strake**:	The FRM doing merely 9 VEG a day only uses like 7 water a day - vs the the 2 HYF on the same space using 160 water a day for 60 VEG


[11-Aug-23 06:07 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Yes. My personal recommendation when you first add HYF's to bulk out on RAT production is to just add a couple and use them to replace your BEA with ALG (or MUS, if you have NS to set on fire). By letting your FRM's work on purely carbs/triglyceride and offloading all the protein to the HYF's, you can still significantly bulk up on output without completely overtaxing your logistics.


[11-Aug-23 06:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Strake**:	ooh, I like that strategy a lot. Very useful stepping stone from FRM to HYF

[16-Aug-23 08:20 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Just scrolling up to the conversation between @Xk37 and @DogeConomy This is why I strongly advocate for "never" putting ENG/SCI on starter planets. The problem with ENG/SCI upkeep is that "everything" eats it. It's not as if you can just provide culture and education and have it go to the ENG/SCI. The Pioneers and Settlers nibble on it too. So while the Scientists here only need 35 points of Culture, as an example, the Pioneers/Settlers will consume up around 14K points. So providing 350 points of culture would be MANY times more than the scientists need, but it would only generate 2-3% fulfillment...which means the scientists/engineers will still be right pissed the fuck off. So to make an economical planet for ENG/SCI, you need to basically make a bespoke planet focusing on higher tier workers with minimal amounts of the lower tier.


[16-Aug-23 08:21 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DogeConomy**:	hear hear


[16-Aug-23 08:21 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	It's also why running planetary festivities in the long run to make up for a POPI deficit sucks, because it boosts populations across the board, artificially spiking the amount of the ENG/SCI food that the lower tiers consume, making the problem ever worse.


[16-Aug-23 08:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DogeConomy**:	hence "band-aid fix"


[16-Aug-23 08:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
***JPulZz** left.*


[16-Aug-23 08:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	So how do you get rid of the scientists and engineers? Different COGC or is there a Chem building that everyone would use that employs another job type?


[16-Aug-23 08:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	I mean, look at Circe with the horde of Engineers. 5712 engineers.....45K pioneers. There is more than 1 engineer per 10 pioneers. Compared to here, where it's almost 100 pioneers per engineer. That's not sustainable.


[16-Aug-23 08:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DogeConomy**:	@Copius you can't


[16-Aug-23 08:24 AM] ApexChat#8127

[16-Aug-23 08:24 AM] ApexChat#8127

[16-Aug-23 08:25 AM] ApexChat#8127

[16-Aug-23 08:26 AM] ApexChat#8127

[16-Aug-23 08:26 AM] ApexChat#8127

[16-Aug-23 08:26 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	You don't need to get rid of ENG/SCI to reduce population upkeep. What they are taking is virtually nothing.


[16-Aug-23 08:26 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	The problem is all the Pioneers/Settlers.


[16-Aug-23 08:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	They're happy off of life support and safety/health alone, but they still CONSUME the higher tier stuff, like culture and education


[16-Aug-23 08:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	well yes, you could go the other route but getting startes to jump into Eng/Sci is a tough road too I imagine


[16-Aug-23 08:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	And the SCI/ENG "must have" that stuff to be happy.


[16-Aug-23 08:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	which is why you end up with all the Pioneers and Settlers on starter planets?


[16-Aug-23 08:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	So in order to keep the higher tier happy, you have to be able to flood the planet with enough Culture/Education to fill EVERYTHING, which costs a fucking fortune


[16-Aug-23 08:28 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DogeConomy**:	Unless a generous benefactor donates millions into Montem's coffers, that's not going to happen realistically (fulfilling everything)


[16-Aug-23 08:29 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Which is why ENG/SCI should "really" be on non-starter planets built out FOR ENG/SCI, because if they're built on top of mega sized piles of pioneers, they're unsustainably expensive without someone just paying for it out of pocket to the tune of many millions a week


[16-Aug-23 08:30 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Basically you want your entry level population for that kind of world to be TEC's, and keep your grubby Pio/Set's the hell off the planet, lol


[16-Aug-23 08:33 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DogeConomy**:	In summary, it's essentially a "catch-22". (not complaining or anything, which is why I'm leaving it here)


[16-Aug-23 08:34 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	Yeah nothing will ever be perfect, can't have it both ways


[16-Aug-23 08:34 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	Still, interesting to hear the rationale for it


[16-Aug-23 08:34 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	I mean, you can. You just have to pay out the nose for it.


[16-Aug-23 08:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	PIO/SET/TEC can all generate natural immigration, ENG/SCI can only be educated into. I'm of the opinion you want a 3 tier spread for any specific planet for maximum efficiency. Pio/Set/Tec, Set/Tec/Eng, or Tec/Eng/Sci. Sustaining 4 tiers is doable, but once you try to sustain from Pio to Sci....good night sweet prince. Hope you have a VERY fat pocketbook, or a population whose ready to pay out the nose for taxes.


[16-Aug-23 08:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Because scientists are picky as all get out. If you had 100% life support, safety, health, and comfort....the SCI's would still be "nope"ing right off the planet.  So you absolutely must have decent fulfillment amounts on Culture/Education to keep them


[16-Aug-23 08:43 AM] ApexChat#8127
***Speedy1haider** left.*


[16-Aug-23 11:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Xk37**:	Oh - that's a very interesting point @Zuul - I guess I didn't realize that PIO/SET will leach off the higher tier stuff. That explains a lot.


[16-Aug-23 12:06 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Yeah, it's not a lot compared to a SCI, but it's there....and there's so MANY of them. Like a SCI, each one, (from memory, so don't yell if I'm off) will eat 0.3 points of education. A PIO meanwhile will only eat 0.02. So 1 Scientist consumes 15 times more education than a pioneer. That being said, if education is COMPLETELY missing, a pioneer will only lose 2% happiness, while scientist tier will lose 30%. So anything not employing SCI (and to a lesser extent ENG) doesn't even need to worry about education, but as soon as you have those workers, you have to educate EVERYTHING.


[16-Aug-23 12:10 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Which is also why SCI taxes tend to be so high. You're not just paying for the scientists upkeep, you're paying for all the EXTRA upkeep that has to be tacked on to every lower tier worker to supply education to the scientists...and usually it's not even paying the bill at max tax rates.


[16-Aug-23 12:14 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Xk37**:	I see.

[23-Aug-23 05:10 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	What's it cost you to run a scientist immigration program?


[23-Aug-23 05:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	@Xk37 I'm just going to lay this out for you. As it stands, this planet can't hold onto ENG/ECI without running PF3 (and even that may not be enough once hitting population targets because the open jobs happiness boost will be gone). So ANYTHING done, that isn't PF3, will result in significant bleed off of workers. Best case scenario for you, Doge can run targeted scientist immigration programs for the next 10 weeks (yes, 10 weeks) to get 120 new scientists give or take a couple (add 25 from program, LOSE 12-14 from happiness). During that time however, we will bleed of well over 1K engineers, maybe 1.5K+. Then PF3 could be re-engaged to secure the sciensts and allow the ENG to begin rebuilding. Long story short, best case scenario, 4 months for full employment.


[23-Aug-23 05:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	The other option is for you to come in and personally build another level of broadcasting hub, library, and university and fund them (although I strongly suspect you'd need at least 2 levels of each).


[23-Aug-23 05:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Option 3 is give up on getting a meaningfully sized SCI population here.


[23-Aug-23 05:23 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	That's pretty much it.


[23-Aug-23 05:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Honestly....I guess there is an option 4, which is to just keep running PF3....but keeping PF3 running for, again, 10 weeks to get to the number of SCI you want, is also going to keep adding thousands of new workers to the planet every week, which will drag down fulfillment across the board, so it will take longer than that.


[23-Aug-23 05:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	@BeBopLula Also, just a note, education fulfillment, and education the function that upgrades workers to the next tier are not associated in any way. Education the uptiering mechanism, is purely a function of happiness, although the presence of any of the POPI buildings that produces education "fulfillment" will also increase the rate of education the uptiering mechanism by their presence (funded or not).


[23-Aug-23 05:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Honestly, if it were up to me, anyone trying to add SCI/ENG would, for lack of a better word, go hang in the short term. Run edu 3 to reduce the upper tier bleed off (3 per week instead of 10+) for the next month and a half to 2 months. That would take care of the Pioneer/Settler overage, then pivot to targeted immigration programs for SCI and reinvest the savings into more education.

**CraftsmanThirteen**:	I don't think there is a solution - the game just isn't designed for what we are trying to do - huge Pio/Set populations and large Eng/Sci - one or the other seems to work


[23-Aug-23 07:33 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DogeConomy**:	yeah... I guess so


[23-Aug-23 07:34 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Having more SCI won't be a blip on POPI. SCI is NOT the POPI consumer here. They are barely a blip on this planets ass in terms of what they consume. Their cost is the fact that they require everything ELSE to be educated to get them the education they need. So there's precious little difference between having 100 SCI and 500 SCI if you're keeping them up.


[23-Aug-23 07:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	But the problem is getting the 100 SCI -> 500 SCI


[23-Aug-23 07:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Sure, that's the problem. That was in reference to "I'm not sure it's worth running SCI immigration programs as it'd require more money to be spent on POPI"


[23-Aug-23 07:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	Oh, okay, I understand.


[23-Aug-23 07:37 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Which is categorically incorrect in any way that's meaningful. Adding "more" SCI won't affect the upkeep costs in any kind of meaningful way. Fractions of a % point.


[23-Aug-23 07:38 AM] ApexChat#8127

[23-Aug-23 08:06 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	So many governors fell back on the "We'll just run PF3 for eternity because it's cheaper fix", well....now the chickens have come home to roost and you can either pay out the eye to sustain that long term, or you can do what's necessary to get pop balances back into whack.


[23-Aug-23 08:08 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DogeConomy**:	Fest III is not sustainable long term since more and more scientists will come and settle at Montem, which means the rate of pop growth on Scientists can't keep up w/ new buildings


[23-Aug-23 08:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DogeConomy**:	So I guess I'll have to do it the hard way


[23-Aug-23 08:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Not sure what you even mean by that. SCI growth wouldn't continue long term anyhow. The second the jobs are filled there would be out migration.


[23-Aug-23 08:10 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Unemployment/open jobs are, technically speaking, your buffer against "modest" population imbalances because they tweak happiness on a per tier basis. The only reason it's not bleeding even now is because of open jobs.


[23-Aug-23 08:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Anyhow, if I can stop typing here for 10 minutes I'll go run proper numbers.


[23-Aug-23 08:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Doge, do you have a calculator for how much of each fulfillment resource a batch of buildings produces in raw numbers given a specific upkeep input? If not, I'll start crunching that by hand too


[23-Aug-23 08:30 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Also, based on my numbers, you actually have enough education POPI here to make this work...right now.


[23-Aug-23 08:31 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	You're just not spending NEARLY enough on culture. Education is locked to the fulfillment of culture. You're pissing quite a lot of education spending straight down the drain as it stands now.


[23-Aug-23 08:39 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Consider the following. You do not want 100% fulfillment across the board if you're doing all needs. You basically want 50% across the board. 50% across the board results in 75/67.5/57.5/55/52.5 for happiness with no unemployment or open jobs. So no population outflows at all, and a constant inflow of pioneers to educate upwards. At 45% you have half the pioneer inflow, and a very minor outflow of scientists, small enough for education to overcome the outflow and continue growth.


[23-Aug-23 08:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	So once the population numbers get rectified, you then want to target 45% for everything. You'll be able to dial back safety by a decent chunk, health by a TON, comfort will be roughly a wash....and then really just drop a couple art galleries and bobs your uncle.


[23-Aug-23 08:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	50% would give a larger safety margin, but anywhere between those two numbers will be happy times. You'll just be trimming or increasing your unemployment reserve by a couple % points.


[23-Aug-23 08:43 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	You could probably even go so far as to fall back to 42 or 43%, and then fall back on a constant PF1 to maintain equilibrium.


[23-Aug-23 08:43 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	And have PF2/3 available to deal with any exigent circumstances


[23-Aug-23 08:47 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MysteriousWalrus**:	Always nice to see some governor related advice


[23-Aug-23 09:58 AM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	All this needs to be written up and added to the Handbook for this game


[23-Aug-23 09:59 AM] ApexChat#8127
**CraftsmanThirteen**:	And extra points for the phrase "and bob's your uncle" - LOL


[23-Aug-23 09:59 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MysteriousWalrus**:	Agreed, on both points :]


[23-Aug-23 10:09 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	It’s subjective to the planet. If you weren’t running higher worker tiers, and therefore not doing higher needs, targeting 45 or 50% fulfillment would be disastrous. If you were doing Safety/Health/Comfort and PIO-TEC, you’d be bleeding TECs all over the place.


[23-Aug-23 10:10 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zuul**:	Hence why I’ve never written anything up on the subject. There’d be so many caveats a readers head would explode.

**Zuul**:	It’s not a problem that there are “lots” of pioneers and settlers. It’s that people decided that it was “cheaper” to run festivities programs to boost the happiness of the higher tiers instead of taking care of them properly. That results in a massive overpopulation of pioneers and settlers, which doesn’t “appear” to be a big deal UNTIL you add higher tier workers because the major expense isn’t added until then. Then you start paying education on all the extra dead weight workers.

[01-Sep-23 10:44 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	Choice of Planet Project can have a big impact.  The major problem Montem currently have is its massive PIO and SET populations.  This makes it hard to keep Scientists and engineers happy and so they migrate off planet


[01-Sep-23 10:45 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	It is therefore very difficult to build higher industry on Montem


[01-Sep-23 10:46 AM] ApexChat#8127
**ABadChoice**:	I see


[01-Sep-23 10:47 AM] ApexChat#8127
**ABadChoice**:	I mean I don't really get it but I get the general shape of it


[01-Sep-23 10:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	but to be honest this is actually a very good design feature by the devs since it forces players to leave the core worlds


[01-Sep-23 10:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**ABadChoice**:	So it's like an opportunity cost thing where you can only provide so much of all the needs combined?


[01-Sep-23 10:55 AM] ApexChat#8127
**ABadChoice**:	And if pioneers are slurping up all the basic ones you've got no resources left for the advanced ones scientists etc want?


[01-Sep-23 11:00 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	It’s quite complex, and this explanation may actually be wrong.  The population can be given five types of goods.  Safety, health, culture, comfort and education.


[01-Sep-23 11:05 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	safety goods are generally cheap, education expensive.  PIO like safety goods, SET like health, etc these goods increase the happiness of that worker class by a larger amount.


[01-Sep-23 11:11 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	If you have 100 total pop and give them 100 safety goods each worker is happier, PIO more happy than SCI.  If you give them 100 education goods, SCI get more happiness than PIO.  The happier a worker is the less likely they will leave the planet.  You want all workers to have at least 50% happiness so they won’t leave but if PIO/SET/TEC happiness goes above 70% the workers migrate to the planet and this population can grow significantly


[01-Sep-23 11:16 AM] ApexChat#8127
***Arin_Sylphia** left.*


[01-Sep-23 11:18 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	What makes workers unhappy is no jobs.  But all workers get a share of the goods given, so on Montem we have got a lot of unemployed PIO and SET who just use the goods so reducing the amount of education goods that end up with the scientist.  To increase the happiness of the scientists you could given more education goods but since these goods are expensive you can end up spending a lot of money keeping scientists happy.


[01-Sep-23 11:20 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	If we could reduce the population for PIO/SET our scientists would be happier because effective they would get more education goods.


[01-Sep-23 11:20 AM] ApexChat#8127
**BeBopLula**:	I think that’s how it works


[01-Sep-23 11:22 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FireFreak**:	pretty accurate


[01-Sep-23 11:32 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MysteriousWalrus**:	That was my general understanding of that sort of situation, but it's nice to see it written :]


[01-Sep-23 11:38 AM] ApexChat#8127
**DarkKing**:	if you need chem scientists now, better find another planet.

**Chezzzy**:	what do i need to increase satisfaction?


[02-Sep-23 10:03 AM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	That's increased by fulfilling the essential needs and luxury needs for that population


[02-Sep-23 10:03 AM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	You can check what's needed at the workforce tab: BS -> base -> workforce


[02-Sep-23 10:04 AM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	If you fill all 3 of the essential goods, you'll get about 79.4% satisfaction. For luxuries, I suggest getting PWOs quickly as they're cheap for the boost they offer. COF is more expensive so that can come later if you don't have cash


[02-Sep-23 10:05 AM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	If you don't have the essential goods, satisfaction (and thus production) takes a big hit

[03-Oct-23 04:53 PM] ApexChat#8127

[03-Oct-23 04:53 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	basically changes how much you repay each time


[03-Oct-23 04:53 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	You can see how it would look after selecting each one


[03-Oct-23 06:01 PM] ApexChat#8127
**ArcturusRex**:	interest loan: only pays interest, then pays back all principal in one lump sum at the end. stable loan: pays an equal amount of principal every period. annuity loan: each period has the same payment (principal + interest)

**Copious**:	The chems are heavily used in a few things that are essentially infinite money sinks, hence the prices.


[08-Nov-23 09:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	AFabs, Nab, some of the luxury consumables.


[08-Nov-23 09:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	PG is more ships I believe, but same idea. Essentially infinite demand.


[08-Nov-23 09:41 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	Unless we were to all suddenly be rookies again that is, but the churn of veteran players keeps the high end production pretty consistent.


[08-Nov-23 09:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	RAT's are similar, which is why Prom is also such a consistent and popular start.


[08-Nov-23 09:42 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	Everyone needs RAT's. It's unlikely you'll ever see them bottom out.

[30-Nov-23 04:15 AM] ApexChat#8127

[30-Nov-23 04:15 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Loggan_Stormfang**:	and it have 119 of SF


[30-Nov-23 04:43 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FireFreak**:	and where are you trying to go?


[30-Nov-23 04:43 AM] ApexChat#8127
