[30-Nov-23 04:43 AM] ApexChat#8127
**clanogrady**:	That's rough, it probably isn't enough fuel to get back to moria


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**--SCHAITR--**:	You're on FREE license and it's going to be hard for us to help you.


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FireFreak**:	yup, not enough STL fuel, as said above :)


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FireFreak**:	bring fuel with your other ship


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FireFreak**:	you can move stuff between ships as long as they're on the same planet


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FireFreak**:	for the future: 50% one way isn't necessarily also 50% the other way


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FireFreak**:	take-off and landing are different, planets move over time, stuff like that


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Loggan_Stormfang**:	but in the travel from Moria to OT-889g supousedly i spent less than the 50% of the SF, why now it spent more than the first travel?


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FireFreak**:	because take-off and landing are different and planets move over time


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Loggan_Stormfang**:	and even if i try a shorter travel, it still stays in "calculating"


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FireFreak**:	because you dont have enough fuel to do the trip even on the lowest setting


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Daegon616**:	if you use 50% of 1500 SF then you will have 750 SF left for the return which would be 100% of the fuel. as the planets orbit in this game then your return journey could be more or less than the 750 fuel remaining


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Daegon616**:	hope that helps


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FireFreak**:	moral of the story: never skimp on fuel in your tanks


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Loggan_Stormfang**:	when you travel to another system, it arrives to the outher planet?


[30-Nov-23 06:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**FireFreak**:	it arrives at whatever planet you set

**ArcturusRex**:	@Tailson The idea of prunplanner is that you can build base plans (how many of what type of buildings, which recipes), and it will calculate how much profit you will make from each plan, and how much many of which materials you will need to supply it.


[04-Dec-23 09:31 AM] ApexChat#8127
**ArcturusRex**:	There's a "help" link in the upper right which will help you get set up

[03-Jan-24 12:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**VonAxe**:	having more then one extractor or smelter, do I need to task them individually or can I command both of the same building to just do the same task in half the time?


[03-Jan-24 12:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**VonAxe**:	meaning, do I get a giant list of buildings? or do they stack?


[03-Jan-24 12:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**VonAxe**:	and how smart is it to have mutiple?


[03-Jan-24 12:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	They stack, so you just put orders in and they are assigned to the buildings in that order


[03-Jan-24 12:44 PM] ApexChat#8127
**VonAxe**:	cool


[03-Jan-24 12:45 PM] ApexChat#8127
**VonAxe**:	so time gets shorter


[03-Jan-24 12:45 PM] ApexChat#8127
**VonAxe**:	do I get to devide multiple extrators between 2 types of ore?


[03-Jan-24 12:45 PM] ApexChat#8127
**VonAxe**:	or is it 1 type and just shorter times so que is diverse to get differnt types


[03-Jan-24 12:46 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	You don't get shorter times


[03-Jan-24 12:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	You put in orders to the extractor and it pulls out whichever ore you put in the order


[03-Jan-24 12:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	again in the same sequence that you put the orders in


[03-Jan-24 12:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**VonAxe**:	thx. :) that'll work for planning how to build


[03-Jan-24 12:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	You can play around with it


[03-Jan-24 12:48 PM] ApexChat#8127
**VonAxe**:	yeah and knowing they will stack helps alot. thx


[03-Jan-24 12:49 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	I mean the orders will stack in the order list but once the order list is empty then the buildings stop working, so unless you have recurring orders then you have to stay on top of the orders


[03-Jan-24 12:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**VonAxe**:	yeah or just make more items at a time so the timer goes up for the order


[03-Jan-24 12:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**VonAxe**:	but then just have enough resource it wont stop your lines


[03-Jan-24 12:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	That's right


[03-Jan-24 12:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Ravick**:	Yep

**--SCHAITR--**:	I'm offering cheaper ship upgrades for new(er) players who would like to upgrade your starter ships to WCBs (3kt/1km3 capacity). DM me if you are interested :)

[14-Feb-24 09:43 AM] ApexChat#8127

[14-Feb-24 09:49 AM] ApexChat#8127

[22-Feb-24 02:15 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	Most ores or minerals are things people usually have a surplus of on their production lines so they sell the excess on the CX but people who need that mat often set up their own ext base so the prices are lower than their wrought product. The wrought product like FE, AL, or S are usually bought much more frequently. So its worth looking into ores and minerals if you want to set up a "middle man" type production


[22-Feb-24 02:18 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	E.g. if I need AL I can either buy from the CX or set up my own metallurgy base. If I set up EXT on an ALO planet I'd rather mine slightly more ALO than my SMEs need so over time I end up with a surplus of ALO that I'll sell for a cheap price on the cx just to get rid of it

**Myrtenaster**:	If you don't have a cx warehouse, the only storage you have is the ship you have docked there


[22-Mar-24 10:45 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	If you buy something from the cx and there isn't enough storage, it is in your Contracts, locked up until you have the storage to accept it

[24-Mar-24 11:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	No penalty if you let a faction contract breach except you lose the amount of faction rep the contract would have been worth. Which barely matters anyway


[24-Mar-24 11:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	40 rep is a lot, double check that that contract is asking you to "provision" the resources (aka you give them to the faction) or just show the resources (sometimes you just have them in your inventory for "inspection" and you keep the resources after the contract is complete)


[24-Mar-24 12:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Rook_Drekar**:	Provision


[24-Mar-24 12:53 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	Yeah that's a huge loss then. Faction rep only dictates the intensity of the contracts. e.g. at 100 rep you might be asked to give 10 resource for 10 currency, but at 1000 rep you give 100 resource for 100 currency


[24-Mar-24 12:53 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	that's as far as I understand it anyway

[18-Apr-24 11:15 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Bobwise**:	usually, how often to repair a production line?


[18-Apr-24 11:15 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Bobwise**:	or how much percentage of condition can I repair once?


[18-Apr-24 11:22 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	Depends on the building, but either 45, 60 or 90 days is the standard.


[18-Apr-24 11:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	It takes 180 days to reach max degradation, so if a building takes 6 BBH, every 30 days 1 BBH will degrade, so you want to repair just before day 30 or just before day 60.


[18-Apr-24 11:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**realbandit**:	Then just adjust to find the optimal days per building


[18-Apr-24 11:24 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Bobwise**:	that makes sense, thx:)

[06-May-24 10:07 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Kilravok**:	Is there a way to increase my warehouse capacity at Montem? I just went to rent two units of warehouse, but my extractor still says, no capacity.


[06-May-24 10:14 AM] ApexChat#8127
***Nerdyboy** joined.*


[06-May-24 10:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Aahz**:	There are two types of storage, warehouses and base storage.  You can see base storage from the base inventory and that is what is full if your extractor can't extract.


[06-May-24 10:17 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Aahz**:	Warehouses are separate and you can store stuff there but your extractors and production facilities can't see the inventory that is in there.


[06-May-24 10:18 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Aahz**:	Also you can build a STO to extend base storage.


[06-May-24 10:18 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Kilravok**:	Thanks


[06-May-24 10:34 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MysteriousWalrus**:	If you're doing extracting, and STO is a very good idea..

[25-May-24 03:29 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Tron842**:	It looks like the raw volume trading for FLX has remained about the same for the past 6 months. It looks like there was a bump in price about a month ago on some CXs and a drop in volume for about a week in late April. After that the price has trended down on all CX's. Especially in AI1. If I had to guess, a trader who was working on arbitrage either switched to something else or was gone for a week or two last month, and the local market is rebounding a bit with all the extra supply locally.


[25-May-24 03:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**stosXri**:	@supwarl, my advice at least at the beggining, dont over invest in one material, focus on chem since you landed on montem. pick buildings that provide choice on recipes


[25-May-24 03:35 PM] ApexChat#8127
**stosXri**:	research all occupation and their profit, it will help you create your next base


[25-May-24 03:38 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Xk37**:	Speaking of arbitrage: I kind of dislike when it's done on a large scale like some players do. I think it's prefectly acceptible when someone is doing it between CX since that helps spread the market, but I cringe when I see large volumes of both buy and sell orders on the same exchange. It's an extractive process that tends to make it harder for small/new players to get a foothold. I realize it's prefectly legal in Prun, but to me it just feels wrong, somehow? I don't know...


[25-May-24 03:42 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Xk37**:	Before anyone flames me: I understand that it provides liquidity and other benefits to the market as well. It just feels slimy to me. IDK...


[25-May-24 04:39 PM] ApexChat#8127

[11-Jun-24 08:34 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Supwarl**:	Use PrunPlanner and you can know exact numbers


[11-Jun-24 09:32 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sir3x**:	without coffee im down to 89% ish


[11-Jun-24 09:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sir3x**:	it adds a decent amount but i feel like unless you have a max capacity base its not worth it for smaller production setups


[11-Jun-24 09:33 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Sir3x**:	if you can find someone to produce it for you by you supplying the materials that would be ideal


[11-Jun-24 10:07 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	You can determine if it's profitable no matter what size base you have


[11-Jun-24 10:08 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	As Supwarl said you can see PrunPlanner for exact numbers


[11-Jun-24 10:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	And you said your weekly expenses are 105k, 14k of which is coffee. Work out your weekly revenue. Coffee adds 11% efficiency so if 14k is less than 11% of your weekly revenue then coffee is still profitable


[11-Jun-24 10:09 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	(Assuming your base is entirely Pioneers)


[11-Jun-24 10:12 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	Correction - COF + PWO is 100% satisfaction. Just PWO is 86.7% satisfaction. So coffee adds 13.3%

[20-Jun-24 01:23 PM] ApexChat#8127

[20-Jun-24 01:47 PM] ApexChat#8127
***Myrtenaster** deleted this message.*


[20-Jun-24 01:50 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Myrtenaster**:	Monopolies usually lower the price as much as possible to drive out smaller suppliers by making them unprofitable, then jack up the price when they control supply. With how easy it is to set up new water suppliers in this game, a monopoly was never going to last forever. At least now those smaller suppliers (new players) can make a living

[09-Jul-24 03:20 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Stephanator**:	what difference does it make? not trying to be sarcastic or anything, i genuinely dont know what choosing someone means for us as players in practice


[09-Jul-24 03:28 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Rook_Drekar**:	When you vote, the candidate that receives the most votes becomes the governor. Depending on the Parliament size, additional players will join the government. The government decides what fees you pay to run your production lines, fees for WH, LM. The government is also generally responsible for supplying POPI consumables to keep the population happy and keep immigration stable.


[09-Jul-24 03:28 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Rook_Drekar**:	The government has a large impact on your base on the planet generally speaking.


[09-Jul-24 03:28 PM] ApexChat#8127

[07-Sep-24 07:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Cyrup**:	If you have rented warehouse space at that CX, it's put there.


[07-Sep-24 07:00 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Cyrup**:	Otherwise, it will be put in a contract - check CONTS (or CONT on the sidebar on desktop)


[07-Sep-24 08:12 PM] ApexChat#8127
**TheDefender221**:	I see. Since I don't have a warehouse on the CX, its in the contract.


[07-Sep-24 08:12 PM] ApexChat#8127

[07-Sep-24 08:14 PM] ApexChat#8127

[07-Sep-24 09:23 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Xk37**:	if you purchased something from the CX and you don't have a warehouse there it will stay in a kind of limbo state indefinitely - no penalty.

Having a high representation level is widely recognized as a testimony of wealth and success. **Ravick**:	Just in case the new players don't know about it - you can click on a player and in the pop-up you will see 3 yellow boxes.  One of those is "Block User".  if you press that then the User is restricted from accepting any of your LM ads.  Sometimes it seems like players believe the blacklist is a word of mouth thing and you have to check every LM contract manually.  Just block the pirates.

[27-Sep-24 10:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
***RIO.CO** joined.*


[27-Sep-24 10:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Aahz**:	LM is the local market, but if you are free to play you can't use it.  The APEX UI should've started you with a trading screen but if you don't have that open a new buffer and type CX NC1


[27-Sep-24 10:05 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Aahz**:	mat bse in another window will show you that BSE are Construction Prefabs, that should help you to find them in the CX.  I believe if you deconstruct a building quickly after constructing it you get all of your materials back as well.

[27-Sep-24 10:30 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Taco0o**:	I have another question. On the trading screen I have a chart module but am unable on how to change the commodity it is currently displaying


[27-Sep-24 10:42 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Aahz**:	try adjusting the intra-day numbers at the top,  the first set of selections is how far back to go and the second is the frequency of data points, so 90d and then 1d means show the last 90 days of trades and give 1 data point per day.


[27-Sep-24 10:43 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Aahz**:	some items aren't traded a ton so depending what titem you are looking at there may be no trades in the last day for instance.


[27-Sep-24 10:46 PM] ApexChat#8127

**F3uertrunk3n**:	I'm looking at the system map, and there's a long line of ships from here to the station. Why are they taking a circular path? Wouldn't it be faster to just go in a straight line instead of using a Hohman transfer like they are in the map?


[21-Nov-24 11:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**bobnobrain**:	Well, ships travel in orbits, and those are elliptic


[21-Nov-24 11:19 AM] ApexChat#8127
**F3uertrunk3n**:	true... you'd think with a travel time of 5 hours, it'd be a more direct route


[21-Nov-24 11:24 AM] ApexChat#8127
**bobnobrain**:	One cannot just fly in a straight line with a star hanging around :D


[21-Nov-24 11:33 AM] ApexChat#8127
**F3uertrunk3n**:	If you go fast enough, you could. But it's much more efficient to go in an orbit.


[21-Nov-24 11:36 AM] ApexChat#8127
**bobnobrain**:	Not just fast, you need to compensate for gravity (or go straight down)


[21-Nov-24 02:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
***kaden11** left.*


[21-Nov-24 03:32 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	there's also the initial velocity to take into account. you can't immediately cancel it when starting, so even if the star's gravitation didn't apply to the ship, the ship would take a similar trajectory

**bill090**:	finally learned about box plots in my statistics class, now i can be even better at this game


[07-Dec-24 02:28 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	too bad it doesn't actually use box plots


[07-Dec-24 02:31 PM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	they look similar, but show different things. in statistics, box plots show separately the median (middle bar) + first/last quartile (the box) + min/max excluding outliers (whiskers). This game's charts show the opening/closing prices (the box) and the min/max (whiskers)

[15-Jan-25 10:46 AM] ApexChat#8127

[15-Jan-25 10:46 AM] ApexChat#8127

[15-Jan-25 10:46 AM] ApexChat#8127

[15-Jan-25 10:47 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Filefolders**:	Here, the program gives a 25% speed bonus to chemistry.


[15-Jan-25 10:47 AM] ApexChat#8127

[18-Feb-25 03:43 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Swonson**:	Hey, new player here: Where do I see the amount of RAT that my Pioneers need?


[18-Feb-25 03:43 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	click on "workforce" in your BS buffer


[18-Feb-25 03:46 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Swonson**:	I might be wrong but, don't I only see the amount of pioneers there? I had 120 required / 200 available / 200 capacity... or am I in the wrong cmd?


[18-Feb-25 03:47 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Swonson**:	sorry for asking stupid questions...


[18-Feb-25 03:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	above that, you have a row with a bunch of yellow buttons. one of them is labeled "workforce"


[18-Feb-25 03:48 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Swonson**:	ahh now I see. Thank you :)


[18-Feb-25 03:50 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	by the way, the "luxury consumables" (COF and PWO) are optional, but highly recommended if you can afford them. they are almost always profitable


[18-Feb-25 03:52 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Swonson**:	Thanks for the tip. I assume, those luxury consumables increase the happiness of my pioneers? If so, does an increased happiness mean a better productivity and faster production or something like that?


[18-Feb-25 03:53 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	correct


[18-Feb-25 03:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Swonson**:	great.


[18-Feb-25 03:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	you can see it from the "satisfaction" in the workforce buffer, and the "efficiency factors" when creating a new order


[18-Feb-25 03:54 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	exact formulae are here: https://pct.fnar.net/workforce/index.html

{Embed}
https://pct.fnar.net/workforce/index.html
Workforce - PrUn Community Derived Information
Efficiency Formulas In every case, any value in brackets (e.g. [DW]) is the percentage fulfilled to your workforce. In most cases, this value is simply 1.0.
Pioneer Pioneer Efficiency = 0.02 * (1+([DW]*10/3)) * (1+([RAT]*4)) * (1+([OVE]*5/6)) * (1+([PWO]*1/11)) * (1+([COF]*2/13))
Settler Settler Efficiency = 0.01 * (1+([DW]*10/3)) * (1+([RAT]*4)...


[18-Feb-25 03:57 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Swonson**:	good to know. Do we have some kind of notepad in apex?


[18-Feb-25 04:03 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	you can open a chat with yourself


[18-Feb-25 04:03 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	there are also browser extensions like https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/refined-prun/ that add a lot of features, including a notepad

{Embed}
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/refined-prun/
Refined PrUn – Get this Extension for 🦊 Firefox (en-US)
Download Refined PrUn for Firefox. Browser extension that simplifies the Prosperous Universe interface and adds useful features
https://images-ext-1.discordapp.net/external/adoHLKN90FGdwiUumJEOvjf2wSLjH4ijXiKTzXBnaas/%3Fmodified%3D1732627579/https/addons.mozilla.org/user-media/previews/full/309/309232.png


[18-Feb-25 04:06 AM] ApexChat#8127

[18-Feb-25 04:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Swonson**:	another question: I placed an order to buy PWO and COF without selecting a rented storage. How can I edit or remove my order? Or is it not necessary to select a storage?


[18-Feb-25 04:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Zugore**:	you can view/edit/remove your order at CXOS, but you don't have to select storage, if you don't have a warehouse or ship at the cx, your completed purchase will appear in CONTS


[18-Feb-25 04:27 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Laerdros**:	The command CXOS shows orders and offers delete.


[18-Feb-25 04:28 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Swonson**:	Thank you


[18-Feb-25 04:28 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Laerdros**:	Even if you specify your ship, if warehouse space is sufficient I think it defaults to the warehouse.


[18-Feb-25 04:29 AM] ApexChat#8127
**Swonson**:	Unfortunately I didn't even had my ship at the exchange... I just realised I have to sent it there


[18-Feb-25 06:25 AM] ApexChat#8127
**MapReduce**:	storage selection in buy order does not matter, it always ends up in the station warehouse (or CONTS), even if you select a ship

[19-Feb-25 07:43 AM] ApexChat#8127
***user96f7273686** left.*


[19-Feb-25 12:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	the one edge case there is if you don't have a warehouse or the warehouse is full it will go to your ship before it goes to conts if there is a ship available


[19-Feb-25 12:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	so it's warehouse>ship>cont in terms of priority


[19-Feb-25 12:03 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	and warehouses, notably, cannot be accessed by base production


[19-Feb-25 12:04 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	so you can have everything you need to make something on planet, in a warehouse, but it won't use it until you put it into base storage


[19-Feb-25 12:04 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Copious**:	that one gets people fairly often their first time around

Efficiency factors :: Prosperous Universe Handbook
General information Each Production Line operates at a certain efficiency when active. Efficiency dictates how long a production order takes to finish: lower efficiency results in longer production times, higher efficiency shortens them. A Production Line’s current efficiency can be looked up in its Production queue buffer (PRODQ):

**Kindly_Enclying_Trading**:	what is a "ghost plot"?


[05-Apr-25 01:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zugore**:	if you open the planet info page, new bfr: PLI OT-580b , in the middle you'll see Available Plots and the numbers 0/418 (+5)


[05-Apr-25 01:51 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zugore**:	thte +5 are ghost plots....there are 418 lots available on the planet, but 423 actual plots occupied


[05-Apr-25 01:52 PM] ApexChat#8127
**Zugore**:	it's only possible on starter worlds, and only because a new player can start anywhere regardless of availability - whereas an existing player is limited to available space to start a base on the planet
